name: ferrochromium production, high-carbon, 55% Cr | ferrochromium, high-carbon, 55% Cr | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19751/documentation

Four out of the seven South African ferrochrome producers have been reported as being active (Creamer, 2016). This means that the other three producers were and are still presumably inactive. Therefore only the active were investigated.;The five producer were Merafe-Glencore (formerly Merafe Xstrata), Samancor Chrome, Hernic Chrome, and Asametal and International Ferro Metals limited (IFML). Some ferrochrome producers produce chromite ore for the market. Samancor uses 70% of the chromite produced annually for ferrochrome production and the remainder is sold to international markets. Hernic Chrome also produces concentrated chromite ore for the market.;The cause for some producers being idle can be attributed to the absence of direct access to chromite ore. This has been speculated to have been caused by chromite ore increasingly being sold to Chinese ferrochrome producers. Current active producer have an integrated chromite and ferrochrome production; REFERENCES: Creamer, M., 2016. Ferrochrome price in sharp rise, s.l.: Mining Weekly.;Pistorius, P., 2002. Reductant selection in ferro-alloy production: The case for the importance of dissolution in the metal. The Journal of the South African Institue of Mining and Metallurgy , 102(1), pp. 33-36.;Visser, M., 2006. An overview of the history and current operational facilities of Samancor Chrome. Southern African Pyrometallurgy , pp. 285-296.;Xstrata, 2006. [Online] ;Available at: http://www.portsregulator.org/images/documents/XSTRATA_submission-Position_Paper_on_Beneficiation.pdf

Activities start includes the mining of the Chromium ore and its concentration and extraction operations

Activities ends with Charge Chrome produced. The vast majority of FeCr produced is charge chrome from Souther Africa. Chrome’s products are transported via rail or road to Richards Bay or Durban ports for export. From the ports the products are shipped to clients in the international market.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/241:Manufacture of basic iron and steel/2410:Manufacture of basic iron and steel

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data were colleted over a perido of 5 years and 2015 was chosen as reference year.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The Merafe-Glencore is the only ferrochrome producer with sustainability reports however the results are mostly aggregated;The expected operation life of the resources given the current capacity is expected to be 100 years. Glencore has vanadium by products in the form of ferrovanadium and vanadium pentoxide.;Eastern limb: Thorncliffe, Magareng and Helena mines are situated along the southern portion of the Eastern Limb of the Bushveld Complex. The MG1 chromitite layer is being mined underground using trackless mining methods on a bord and pillar mining layout.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Ferrochrome or Charge Chrome is a major product of Chrome’s product line. Charged chrome is an iron and chromium alloy (55-55% Cr, 7% C, 4% Si) produced in open, submerged and DC arc furnaces. Submerged furnace ;Chromite ore consisting of iron oxides, chromium oxides, magnesium oxides and aluminium oxides mixed with carbon sources in batches for the endothermic reduction reactions (Visser, 2006). ;The aluminium and magnesium oxides have high melting temperature therefore fluxes of limestone, dolomite and quartz are applied to condition the slag phase for ease of tapping (Visser, 2006). The CO produced in submerged furnaces is burnt with oxygen to heat furnace feed. From the furnace slag is tapped. After tapping it is de-slagged, granulated, cast into ingots or transferred into the next phase of processing (Visser, 2006). ;Intermediate-carbon ferrochrome is processed from hot charge chrome slag. The product has a lower silicon and carbon content, less than 0.3% and 1.5% respectively. Figure below shows a diagram of the process. The hot slag charge chrome is transferred to a CLU converter where oxygen and on site generated steam (CO from closed furnace) blown in the bottom of the vessel. Burnt lime and dolomite are used to strip Si from the metal to from SiO2. As more CO is produced, the carbon content (C) content is decreases. When the slag suitable carbon grade the slag is tapped and thereafter granulated. The granulated product is the transported for export (Visser, 2006). ;;Visser, M., 2006. An overview of the history and current operational facilities of Samancor Chrome. Southern African Pyrometallurgy , pp. 285-296.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data are based on the Merafe-Glencore (ferrochrome producer) sustainability reports and the following other sources:                                       Creamer, M., 2016. Ferrochrome price in sharp rise, s.l.: Mining Weekly.
Pistorius, P., 2002. Reductant selection in ferro-alloy production: The case for the importance of dissolution in the metal. The Journal of the South African Institue of Mining and Metallurgy , 102(1), pp. 33-36.                      
Visser, M., 2006. An overview of the history and current operational facilities of Samancor Chrome. Southern African Pyrometallurgy , pp. 285-296.
Xstrata, 2006. [Online] Available at: http://www.portsregulator.org/images/documents/XSTRATA_submission-Position_Paper_on_Beneficiation.pdf

exchanges.description: Ferrochrome (or Charge Chrome) production. Value based on Merafe-Glencore production values. Merafe Sustainability Report (2016).

exchanges.description: This accounts specifically for: tailing and processing wastes and regulated ferrochrome slimes (from metal recovery). Previously all mineral waste was stored together was not treated before disposal in specially designed faciliities on site. This made it legally claissified as hazardous material. Of late sludge which has a high concentration of Cr (VI) is treated before disposal. Slag constitutes most of the mineral waste, it is reprocessed when possible. Otherwise all mineral waste is stockpiled. Overburden is used for backfilling.
